website_summaries.verdict: The HL-2360DW is a strong choice if you're shopping for a text-only printer that can print from the cloud and won't empty your wallet on toner refills.
pros: Easy installation, small footprint, supports cloud printing through Google Cloudprint and Apple AirPrint, inexpensive
cons: Brother includes a "starter" grade toner cartridge that won't take long to deplete

customer_reviews.title: Fast and dependable. As usual, from Brother.
customer_reviews.text: Have owned Brother printers for years. Simple, easy to use and set up. Always a pleasure hooking them into our home network. Fast print speeds, excellent for documents. Always come out crisp and clean. Always look professional. Last 1 lasted 8 years under heavy use in my home office. Cant ask for more than that. Toner is a snap 2 change. Easy, simple to use. I always use the high yield cartridges. Good for thousands of prints. Once you own 1 of these printers, youll never go back to an ink jet.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonhead

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you have excellent hearing!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this printer if you have excellent hearing. In standby mode, a small fan runs continuously, causing a quiet high-pitched whine. It's very subtle, but if you have keen hearing you'll definitely be annoyed by it. The only thing I could do was to turn off the printer until I need to use it, then turn it off again after I use it. This is really frustrating, since otherwise this is a perfect printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, inexpensive laser
customer_reviews.text: I've been delighted with this little thing. It's quiet, fast, and despite what the manual implies you can set it up for wireless operation (I use AirPrint) with no computer connection at all. Duplex operation works flawlessly. It's got relatively little on-board memory, so complex pages or photos take a bit longer (10 seconds) to print, but for the price I'm fine with that.
customer_reviews.author: Don Jones

customer_reviews.title: and easy to access the paper tray and toner
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded mostly because I wanted the ethernet cable to connect instead of wireless, but otherwise just use this as a simple printer. My MacBook and my wife's Win10 laptop both saw this printer on the network instantly, and it prints cleanly with high variance in the amount of grayscale. It's quick, not a large printer, quiet, and easy to access the paper tray and toner. Feels very solid and based on my experience I'd happily recommend even the simpler versions if you don't mind using wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Work horse
customer_reviews.text: My wife does a lot of couponing and an ink jet got to be very expensive. Picked this up and it has saved us a bunch. We get thousands of print out from a single print cartridge. If you do a high volume of black and white printing, its the smart choice. 1 thing that could be improved on is that it goes into deep sleep mode sometimes and it takes unplugging it for a few minutes to get it back alive.
customer_reviews.author: Don J

customer_reviews.title: The replacement cartridges are what makes this an incredible value ...
customer_reviews.text: Thereplacement cartridges are what makes this an incredible value. I kept my old inkjet printer for the rare occasion I need to print color but everything else gets routed to this printer.
customer_reviews.author: replayrebTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works great on my network, and is blazingly fast
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I got this a few days ago to replace a $2,500 HP LaserJet printer from the mid-1990s, and I'm impressed by what a hundred bucks will buy these days. Setup went quickly, and I'm now happily using this speedy, efficient printer with my office computer (on an Ethernet connection) and--on Wi-Fi--with a Windows laptop, a Chromebook, and an Android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Durant Imboden

customer_reviews.title: Garbage printer
customer_reviews.text: It’s either offline or in sleep mode. We literally have to unplug everything and carry it back to our WiFi modem, wait forever for it to reconnect and then bring it back to the office and replug it in, print really quickly before it goes into sleep mode. This the worst printer we’ve had. It worked normally for about 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: Franny J

customer_reviews.title: I like and also dislike this printer
customer_reviews.text: I like and also dislike this printer. Likes: Very fast, Easy setup, prints alot before needing changed (ink cartridge) Dislikes: Doesn't print when you always like it too, lags alot, I find it printing things even when I don't print things, can not be connected to our cell phones to print.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Young

customer_reviews.title: Even though this printer is only black and white printing ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though this printer is only black and white printing, the value of this can not be beat! This printer is fast. After having the ink dry out wrecking the print heads on inkjet printers, I will never go back to them after using this printer. This printer's ink does not dry out. The starter cartridge for this printer will last you an amazingly long time and the refills are very economical.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clinton

customer_reviews.title: It's very annoying.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it advertises: prints fast, black-and-white duplex. Compared to what networked duplex laser printers used to cost, it's a colossal value. Compared to other printers today though, I wouldn't buy it again. It has one huge flaw: the output tray can't hold more than 1 or 2 sheets before new prints begin pushing the old ones onto the floor. It's very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forced replacement of ink cartridges?!
customer_reviews.text: It's noisy, super noisy. It hums away in the background and is distractingly loud. Prints well in black and white. The most annoying thing is replacing the ink. When it runs low the printer refuses to work until you replace it. I know there's ink in there, enough to print. I will decide when I replace the ink not (big) Brother. I hate it as it's wasteful and they take the decision out of my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but difficult if you have a Mac.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good printer. I do not put it to heavy use. Be aware that if you have a Mac computer the wireless connect can be problematic. Brother recommends that you use a cable initially, which I did not have nor wish to purchase. The manual programming through the control panel was difficult and I am more tech savvy than many. Plus I needed to do this repeatedly until I got through to a Mac tech person on Brother's support line. The wait for this was quite long, also, as I had to wait in line a second time to get through to a Mac trained tech.
customer_reviews.author: Juna Berry Madrone

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a dependable wireless printer in the house! With the 700 page toner cartridge plus I bought a 12,000 page cartridge I don't plan on having a printer glitch in the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Masarone

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome printer. Occasionally goes offline with Windows 10 but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome printer. Occasionally goes offline with Windows 10 but that is not the printers' issue... Brother is a fantastic company and these printers are well worth the purchase. Also, after market toner cartridges work great. Good deal, highly recommend..
customer_reviews.author: Renegade

customer_reviews.title: What a dream to setup. Had it connected to ...
customer_reviews.text: What a dream to setup. Had it connected to my wireless network and printing on my desktop, laptop and Google phone in no time. I did google "setup HL-L2360DW WPS and followed the instructions". Piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O'Grady

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive printer, with inexpensive toner, easy setup, easy to use, small desk footprint, and tech support that is easy to contact when needed, all combine to give this printer a 5 star rating with no reservations at all. Great printer for a small/home office user that just needs a printer that works well without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bird

customer_reviews.title: Paying for itself.
customer_reviews.text: I have ran over three thousand copies and and am impressed with the quality of the print and the speed which the printer spits them out.The money I'm saving on color ink will pay for the printer and then some.Unless,you need color this is the machine for you.Keep in mind this is a printer and that is all it does, but it does that very well.For the price this machine is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Tommie Godwin

customer_reviews.title: I hate that it goes to sleep mode and takes a ...
customer_reviews.text: I hate that it goes to sleep mode and takes a while to come back to use. The menu is very limited. Can't get it to work with my WIFI because it times out, by my HP works great!
customer_reviews.author: EVESANDI

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit noisy, and feels a bit cheap, but it's compact and had super-easy setup and that's what I wanted. Print quality is not as good as the Canon MF4150 it is replacing, but acceptable for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Gannet

customer_reviews.title: This laser printer is great; we now use two- one for home use ...
customer_reviews.text: This laser printer is great; we now use two- one for home use and one we sent off to college with our son. Duplex printing, very fast; sharp ,crisp print-its all you could ask for and the price can"t be beat. The toner cartridge lasts for about 2,000 pgs and and an aftermarket cartridge (ONYO) is only $15 bucks with free shipping and works great. Best printer/ink combo I've ever had. If you're looking for a strictly B&W printer, this is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: MRL

customer_reviews.title: OK low-end printer.
customer_reviews.text: Really doesn't do that impressive of a job, and seems to have an issue printing directly from postscript applications like InDesign or Illustrator. Blacks print as grays, so type isn't clean. Has other issues... as outlined elsewhere. It's OK for very basic usage, but don't expect anything really impressive if you've ever owned a higher-end laser.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Drostdy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little work horse!
customer_reviews.text: Iv'e had so many printers (both color and black and white) break or start printing poorly. I can't believer this little thing works so well when it was so cheap. It is simple and relatively quiet. It isn't the fastest but it's fast enough that I don't notice myself waiting on it. it's light weight and takes up very little space on the table or a desk. Just a fantastic little printer. Oh. . . ink isn't overly expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Automatic feed no longer responds to on-line print command
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few days, now no longer prints on-line. Paper tray is loaded,but receive error message That paper tray is in need of paper or must add paper to manual feed. I checked tray for fit and paper amount, but still receive error message. Did not see troubleshooting repair on Brother trouble shooting site.
customer_reviews.author: alllan j

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST PRINTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST PRINTER EVER. I'm on the first cartridge of ink, which is the starter cartridge, and it has already printed 500+ pages. In addition this printer is super fast, and it automatically prints on both sides of the paper. Printing used to be a chore, but I love printing with this printer. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Allipie77

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Great quailty print, fairly easy setup to both local network and Google, and one of the lower cost replacement toners
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Bought two othe brother printers and they were great. Replaced my HP laser with this printer and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of my HP . Changed ink cartridge and would not align. Threw it out . Bought two othe brother printers and they were great. Replaced my HP laser with this printer and it is great. Fast and prints well. Good deal. .
customer_reviews.author: Steve, Bensalem PA

customer_reviews.title: Super printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Both as a wired and wireless network printer, it is quick to start printing and fast. After years of using a HP LaserJet, this really stands out. Along with the Brother ImageCenter ADS-2000 High Speed Document Scanner, these are a great pair for a home office!
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: very good product. Love the double-sided feature as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 months now and so far, very good product. Love the double-sided feature as well as the wireless connection. The air print - from iOS (iPhone) is also convenient. I had an older version of this product and it was a fabulous work horse. Glad to know the quality still remains.
customer_reviews.author: Dona

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper to replace!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in May of 2017, with very light home printing it fails to pick up the paper to print. It is cheaper for me to buy a new one than to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Valenta

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer that is fairly small
customer_reviews.text: Very good printer that is fairly small. Wifi is hard to setup sometimes, and it doesn’t include a usb cable to connect to you pc.
customer_reviews.author: Apples

customer_reviews.title: Poor wireless printing with MAC computers.
customer_reviews.text: Not very functional with MAC computer. Wireless printing with a MAC is next to impossible. Customer service was terrible. They were unable to resolve my wireless printing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brother Utilities is completely useless. Online support is useless
customer_reviews.text: Works well until you need to reboot the wireless network. After you've already used the initial setup wizard, re-entering the network key for a secure network is a real pain. Brother Utilities is completely useless. Online support is useless. Very frustrating to simply find anywhere to enter the network password, let alone the printer actually accepting it. Printer works great, but NOT user friendly at all to re-connect to your network.
customer_reviews.author: TigerTail

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Thought I was ordering a color printer though. My mistake. Miss having a scanner
customer_reviews.author: George Wimsatt

customer_reviews.title: Brother L2360DW
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for over two years and is still going.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C Placerncia

customer_reviews.title: It works great after we finally got it set with my Mac ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great after we finally got it set with my Mac blue. If you have an apple / Mac go on line to set up, do not use the CD as it's for PC'S.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy L Bell

customer_reviews.title: No Bells & Whistles: A Printer that Prints
customer_reviews.text: Our ordered was processed and delivered quickly. Very pleased. It's a printer that prints. We did not need a scanner copier or a fax. We have apps for those.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Savino

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup
customer_reviews.text: Printer works fine, but setup was difficult. The printer refused to recognize my wireless network until the fourth or fifth attempt, and the printer was two feet away from my router. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value, constructed nice, works well, no problem, use it with Mac, Linux, and Win 10 devices!
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Everything just works.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned by reviews on this product saying it was unreliable or wireless didn’t work when asleep. This wasn’t my experience at all. I plugged it in, turned off deep sleep, ran the install software and that was it. No issues printing from network or phone/iPad. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wong

customer_reviews.title: I Have a Nice Color Laser...
customer_reviews.text: ...but this one is the one I use all the time because it is so much cheaper to run. And it works perfect for blowing through pages and pages of text. And if you just need to be able to read what you print, you can set the DPI down and save even more toner.
customer_reviews.author: PBR118

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer - good for office use. Doesn't go through toner like crazy. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Roy

customer_reviews.title: I will say it's a little noisy but so far it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the vet Clinic I work at to speed up our check out time. I will say it's a little noisy but so far it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shaya

customer_reviews.title: Online without a problem!
customer_reviews.text: Got it online in a flash! HP 102 was on the phone with HP for over an hour with no luck. Was told that they have problems with the cheaper models. The Brother was online with setup and a laptop (Macintosh) within 15 minutes total. Totally satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: wbump25

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Failure With OS X - Printer Stuck In Deep Sleep Mode, Firmware Update Fails To Load Properly
customer_reviews.text: The wireless function failed to work because the printer goes into a "deep sleep" mode. I contacted the company, who responded that this is a known problem with OS X, and there was a firmware update. However, the firmware update failed to load properly. The printer works fine when directly connected, but it was purchased with the expectation of being able to use in WiFi mode, and this has proved a frustrating and time-consuming failure.
customer_reviews.author: DAndS

customer_reviews.title: Ink Jet should be a second choice...
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to ink jets and expensive ink. Default printer for every family member. Saved a bunch the first month in use.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice to be able to afford a good wireless laser printer finally. The wireless works well if in the same room as the router. The toner that comes with is only a sampler, order a new one when you purchase. Prints nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: It's Chuck Norse

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, fast and no more tracking of 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, fast and no more tracking of 5 inkjet cartridges. Black and white printing is fine for 95% of my printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: CCOZ

customer_reviews.title: Good value, decent GUI on PC.  Setup could be much better.
customer_reviews.text: Setup should be done with a USB cable A to B oldschool USB for devices. Quiet and fast so far.
customer_reviews.author: APersonInWisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is excellent. 1st page speed is a bit slow but ...
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced duplex laser printer. Print quality is excellent. 1st page speed is a bit slow but next page speed is very good
customer_reviews.author: New2This

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price. Prints faster than I was expecting, and double-sided too!
customer_reviews.author: Thomasio

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer BUT, please note it is NOT a copier or scanner
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble setting up this printer. It is quiet and the print quality is crisp. HOWEVER, until Amazon fixes the website description--please note it is NOT a copier or a scanner. I thought maybe I didn't understand how to feed the paper to have it scan/copy so I got a hold of Brother and they confirmed it doesn't have that capability. So, if you need copying/scanning capabilities, try the HL-L2380DW. It has a larger footprint, but it definitely can copy and scan. I must say that Amazon ROCKS when it comes to customer service. I've never received better.
customer_reviews.author: speedybee62

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. It is exactly what I needed. Wonderful item in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: clm

customer_reviews.title: Impressive printer
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. We use it with Google Cloud Print, and with Apple Air Print.
customer_reviews.author: Ric DonatoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked for 1.5 months and then quit working. The seller refuses to stand behind the product. Do NOT buy from Amazing Lighing deal.
customer_reviews.author: JSM

customer_reviews.title: cheap easy
customer_reviews.text: Works as expect for a cheap printer. Easier to set up than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: R.T.

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work fine..
customer_reviews.text: Appears to work fine ...when I can figure out how to use the various features. Lack of a user manual is frustrating. The link to the online user manual is broken ...nothing there. Brother support has been promising to link to the manual for almost 3 weeks now. To be fair, their support people have offered to help me with any questions I have but I like to read and learn all the features in one sitting. I don't expect the support group to spend all that time tutoring me.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but close.
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is pretty good, though not as dense in larger solid black areas as my older Samsung. However, it is much quieter and faster. It also seems to load paper more reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Suecasa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loaded software on Windows 7, Linux Mint 14, and Linux Mint 17.1. All print with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: ) Love the small footprint and the easy netowrk integration with ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a Brother laser. (No. Really. It's impossible.) Love the small footprint and the easy netowrk integration with my other Brother lasers. Super wuick ship, It was delivered two days after ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Sholl

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-L2360DW Compact Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: The Brother HL-L2360DW Compact Laser Printer works well with the exception I never could get it to hook up to my Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Termite

customer_reviews.title: Plug in and go. Never had a problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: Plug in and go. Never had a problem with this brand and model. Will stick with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: good concept very poor user interface ruins it
customer_reviews.text: The setup menu is a nightmare to navigate, you have to constantly reenter wifi password data, good concept very poor user interface ruins it.
customer_reviews.author: KARL R TRIEBEL

customer_reviews.title: brother products R the bomb
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! Great instruction for using it with the various Window's systems!
customer_reviews.author: murph55

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy. Had to download the software as the disc ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy. Had to download the software as the disc didn't work. I already had a usb cable from my old printer to use to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good Black and white Laser Jet
customer_reviews.text: Good Black and white Laser Jet, arrived pretty early much earlier than promised , but Unfortunately no Scanning. Not bulky , medium size. Another printer, the Brother HL-i2380 does the scans too. So had to return this and purchase the i2380. So really did not open the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Prabhakar S Neppalli

customer_reviews.title: Vendor did fine job.
customer_reviews.text: problem with printer - returned to vendor. Vendor did fine job.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly with no issues. Very easy set up and works as expected..
customer_reviews.author: missinglink

customer_reviews.title: The wireless was easy to set up and with years behind it
customer_reviews.text: This is an affordable printer - mostly because the knock off ink works well with it. The wireless was easy to set up and with years behind it, it is a proven workhorse for small office and home use. I love that I can print out of my iphone directly to this printer and that it prints fast and is reliable. For b&w every day printing this is a great printer...I wish it was a little smaller but hey - can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth LA

customer_reviews.title: A great way to waste both ink and paper as two ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't stop double-sided printing. So I print out a return label for Amazon and it prints the lithium battery warning on the opposite side as the mailing label, so I have to print the thing twice. A great way to waste both ink and paper as two pages are printed off each time. The printer says that double-sided printing is off, but clearly that is not the case. Brother has not responded to my request for assistance.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: It's a Great Quality Printer and a Very Economical Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brother Laser Printer and with this model, install was very easy . . . just put the disc in the computer and then follow the prompts.. Brother laser printers offer good, quality printing that is very affordable to use. The print is clear, sharp, and doesn't smudge on the paper. I don't know what the "deep sleep" is about so I can't write about that but I can honestly say that you won't be disappointed in the quality of the print for this very economical printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: just love it. It is fast and can be set ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else to say, just love it. It is fast and can be set up for WIFI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Print great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Print great for the price. Had a little issue of WIFI printing but solved in 1 hour
customer_reviews.author: HarrisonOC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. 2-Sided printing works flawlessly and saves paper
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: great printer. Out of all of the printer I owned. This one beats the rest. It holds 250 sheets. It hasn't jammed on me. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would have paid $1000 for this printer 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: This is the Best printer to work with Google Cloud Print. If you use a chromebox or chromebook, This is the printer that you want. I plan on buying at least 4 more. Also check out the Brother ADS-1500W for a document scanner that will work with chrome. Thank you Brother for a product that allows the Chrome operating system to work without print servers or a Mac or PC on site. This printer solved the last hurdle for running Chrome OS solo in a business environment.
customer_reviews.author: nforest

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, found the printer to be very, very noisy while printing as if some mechanism was loose. Found a resolution to the problem after a quick search through the Brother support site. Result: The toner cartridge was not properly seated in the drum and toner assembly as shipped. Reseating the toner cartridge solved the problem. [...] Aside from this initial issue, I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MtrMaid

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy - Breezy to set up! Double-sided capability saves paper and is very convenient. Best Buy Ever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer, issue with paper feeder
customer_reviews.text: Set up was quick and easy on my Mac. It's relatively quite and speedy. Print quality is good. I would rate it a 5 except for one annoying issue. I've experienced considerable difficulty with the paper feed. Nearly every time I need to print, I get a "no paper" message despite the tray being full of quality paper. I then have to fuddle around with the paper, move it forward, adjust it, etc., before it will finally print. It's rather annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Very good value printer. Perfectly silent. 100% Linux compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly silent when not in use. I appreciate also the possibility to set it up completely remotely (without having to plug a cable to it or anything else). However, remember to configure your router to make sure the printer gets always the same IP address assigned otherwise you will have to redo the configuration every time you have to restart your printer. I also bought this model because it is PCL compliant so it works like a charm with Linux (actually with my Ubuntu 14.04).
customer_reviews.author: thibauld favre

customer_reviews.title: super easy to set up and its wireless
customer_reviews.text: nicest printer ive owned for home. super easy to set up and its wireless! print quality is dope!
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it said it would do and does it well. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Works great but it took me along with a very patient ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but it took me along with a very patient Brother tec an hour to set up the wireless it now works with our iPads, iPhones, laptop and computers. It was worth the time to set it up we it should save us some ink money!
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Speedy, but print is somewhat light/thin
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading from an HP LJ 5MP (mid 1990s), the increase in printing speed is a welcome relief. The wifi setup worked fine. My only complaint is that the print seems somewhat lighter and thinner than what I'm used to.
customer_reviews.author: jsc

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, high quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer to print black images so that I can foil them using the Royal Sovereign 9-Inch Laminator (CS-923) The prints are good quality and add to the successful outcome of my card making projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Much better are available
customer_reviews.text: I’m totally disappointed in this printer and Brother's so called "support". This printer will not print legible copies that contain graphics or pictures. It prints so dark and uses so much toner that the newsletters it produces are not worth mailing to our membership. I've reverted to having our printing done at Staples until I can get a replacement. I would have returned it but Brother's so-called "support" kept dicking me around so long the eligible return period ran out and now I'm stuck with it. I've had and still have other Brother products that gave good service but this L2360DW printer has me looking for other sources of quality products.
customer_reviews.author: RVthereyet

customer_reviews.title: OK Printer, with some caveats...
customer_reviews.text: Good price, nice printing quality, but the "Deep Sleep" mode is a pain (update firmware to fix) and the included cartridge only lasted for 527 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lustig

customer_reviews.title: Too loud for me.
customer_reviews.text: It works but sounded like a bereaved rhinoceros when not in "quiet" (and slow) mode. I spent the extra bucks and got an HP instead,
customer_reviews.author: Leon Kunstenaar

customer_reviews.title: This is a top quality printer and the ease of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality printer and the ease of installing and using the wireless feature has made us very happy
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Eden

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 5 days
customer_reviews.text: After initial setup and test (went fine) the printer was offline (in sleep mode) for several days. Today it's showing offline, does not power up when power button is pressed - shows no signs of receiving power from the outlet (tried 4 different ones). Tomorrow I'm returning it. What a waste of shipping money. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Faustas Zilinskas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking and functioning printer. Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Buether

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer EVER
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer EVER. It goes to sleep and refuses to wake up - i tried turning the deep sleep off which i think it did but it it still randomly stops responding to print jobs. It also lost its internet connection settings and I had to reset.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Ink jet printers dry out before you take the plastic off. Don't do it to yourself and B/W is best. unless is need color.
customer_reviews.text: Laser printers are better than Ink Jet printers. I returned this model because it don't have scan/wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: I have three different Brother Model printers in my office and would rate them all excellent but not this model
customer_reviews.text: I have ALWAYS used Brother printers. The printing on this one was not sharp right out of the box. I have three different Brother Model printers in my office and would rate them all excellent but not this model.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted in a printer
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but be warned this printer does NOT have a scanner!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: we go through a high capacity toner cartridge in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Brian T Hill

product_meta.title: Brother HL-L2360DW Compact Laser Printer with Wireless Networking and Duplex, Amazon Dash Replenishment Enabled,Black
product_meta.description: The Brother HL-L2360DW is a reliable, affordable monochrome laser printer for home or small office use. This desk-friendly, compact printer with an up to 250-sheet capacity tray connects with ease via wireless networking, Ethernet, or Hi-Speed USB 2.0 interface and prints crisp black and white documents at up to 32 ppm. Print from compatible mobile devices over your wireless network. Automatic duplex printing helps save paper.
feature_bullets: Upon activation, the Amazon Dash Replenishment service measures the toner level and automatically orders toner from Amazon when low. This ensures that you never run out again.
Prints black/white documents at up to 32 pages per minute
250-sheet input tray for extended use without constantly refilling
Connects via wireless networking, Ethernet or a hi-speed USB 2.0 interface

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars509 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
